wikipedia_page.main: Elspeth Beard (born 28 April 1959) is an architect and motorcyclist, who is noted for being one of the first English women to ride a motorcycle around the world. Later on, she redesigned Munstead Tower in Godalming, winning the 1994 Royal Institute of British Architects award for South East England. Beard now owns an architectural firm based in a converted stable in Godalming.

response: Significant people currently living in the town include the actress Rachel Hurd-Wood, Great Britain field hockey player Dan Fox, Scottish international footballer John Hansen, mathematics author Matt Parker and his wife, the physics professor Lucie Green, chess grandmaster and author Simon Williams, and sociologist Sara Arber. Architect Elspeth Beard, who lives in the renovated town water tower, was the first English woman to motorcycle around the world.
*Elspeth Beard, first Englishwoman to circumnavigate the world by motorcycle in the 1980s
